data.title: Google confirms DOJ scrutiny, preps for investigation from states
data.text: The search giant said it has sent records to the US Department of Justice.

data.title: Alphabet confirms that DOJ is pursuing antitrust review
data.text: In a regulatory filing on Friday, Alphabet confirmed that it received a "civil investigative demand" from the DOJ.

data.title: Google files patent for using A.I. to track a baby's body and eye movements
data.text: In a patent application published this week, Google indicated it's looking into how artificial intelligence can be used to watch for abnormal behavior in babies.

data.title: Apple rebuts scope of iPhone OS vulnerability found by Google
data.text: Apple Inc. AAPL, +0.26% on Friday hit back at operating-system vulnerabilities identified by researchers at Alphabet Inc.

data.title: Apple fires back at Google report over iPhone security flaws
data.text: On Friday, Apple said in a sharply worded statement that the attacks identified by Google were through websites targeted towards Uighurs, a Muslim ethnic minority in China.

data.title: Apple disputes Google security researcher findings on iPhone attack
data.text: Apple Inc  on Friday disputed the way that researchers at Alphabet Inc's  cybersecurity team characterized an iPhone security flaw that they said could be used to track users of the smartphone in real time.

data.title: Facebook, Google didn't plan on being monopolies, but are now too powerful, tech investor says
data.text: "They've had an inexorable growth beyond anyone's original expectations and as a result, they've become too big and too pervasive in our whole lives," says Greycroft founder Alan Patricof

data.title: Google bans ads for 'unproven or experimental medical techniques' like stem cell therapy
data.text: The new Google ads policy may put the heat on for the stem cell clinic industry, which has until recently been largely unregulated.

data.title: Big Tech companies like Facebook, Amazon to face antitrust probe by U.S. state attorneys general
data.text: A bipartisan group of state attorneys general will announce on Monday an investigation into large tech companies, like Facebook and Google, for potential violations of antitrust law, Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton's announced on Friday.

data.title: It's very early in antitrust probes into Big Tech, says antitrust expert
data.text: Steve Houk, former head of the New York Attorney General Antitrust bureau, joins "Squawk on the Street" to discuss how Microsoft's antitrust case from the 1990s applies to new antitrust probes into Big Tech.

data.title: Tile teams up with Google to bring its lost item finding technology to Google Assistant
data.text: As rumors about Apple’s plans to launch a Tile competitor swirl, Tile today announced it’s teaming up with Google to make it easier for users to locate their lost items using their Android devices and Google Assistant. For the uninitiated, Tile is a small hardware accessory that you can attach to items like keys, purses, […]

data.title: New York AG Confirms Antitrust Investigation Into Facebook, Google Is Reportedly Next
data.text: New York State Attorney General Letitia James said Friday that her office is commencing a multistate antitrust investigation into Facebook, Inc.

data.title: Telenav Says GM Contact Unaffected By Deal Between Automaker, Google
data.text: Telenav, Inc. (NASDAQ: TNAV) has responded to an announcement made by General Motors (NYSE: GM), stating it has a strong relationship with the auto company, with a contract effective through model year 2025.

data.title: US states to launch antitrust and privacy inquiries into Facebook and Google
data.text: New York state attorney general said bipartisan coalition investigating if Facebook stifled competition and put users at risk.

data.title: More Cloud Revenue Is Critical to Moving Google Stock up Again
data.text:
Google is being treated as a piggy bank by regulators, and politicians are demanding its break-up. This lends urgency to efforts to increase its share of the hybrid cloud market
The post More Cloud Revenue Is Critical to Moving Google Stock up Again appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Small business CEO criticizes Google's advertising practices
data.text: The CEO of Basecamp, a small and private technology company sounded off on Google's advertising practices on Twitter.

data.title: U.S.-China Trade Talks to Resume: 5 Winners
data.text: With the United States and China expected to hold talks in "early October," these stocks are poised to gain the most.

data.title: Alphabet Stock Suffers from Having Too Much of Its Value Locked Up
data.text:
Accusations of lax data privacy protections have hurt Alphabet stock, but unlocking value in the company could help rescue GOOGL.
The post Alphabet Stock Suffers from Having Too Much of Its Value Locked Up appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: State AGs to launch separate Facebook, Google probes: WSJ
data.text: State attorneys general are formally launching separate antitrust probes into Facebook Inc.
